previous_goals.goal: i think i just take forever to fall asleep i think turn them off an hour before i want to go to sleep and i want to work on this for 4 weeks

measurable.issue: No metric to track success - doesn't specify how to measure if falling asleep is improving or what 'taking forever' means

analysis.suggestions: Add a measurable outcome, such as: 'Turn off screens 1 hour before bedtime to fall asleep within 30 minutes (instead of current 60+ minutes) for 4 weeks, tracking nightly in a sleep journal.'

smart_analysis.suggestions: Add a measurable outcome, such as: 'Turn off screens 1 hour before bedtime to fall asleep within 30 minutes (instead of current 60+ minutes) for 4 weeks, tracking nightly in a sleep journal.'

goals_to_keep: i think i just take forever to fall asleep i think turn them off an hour before i want to go to sleep and i want to work on this for 4 weeks
session_data.last_coach_response: I hear you - you're worried that when finals studying ramps up, it'll be harder to stick with turning off your devices an hour before bed, even though the alarm has been really helpful so far. That's a valid concern, especially with the pressure of exams coming up.

conversation_history.content: Hey Jade, welcome back! It's great to see you for our second session. How has your week been going?
That's great to hear! So, how did it go with turning off your devices an hour before you wanted to go to sleep this past week?
That's wonderful, Jade! I'm so glad to hear it went well. On a scale of 1 to 10, how stressed were you this week?
I hear you, Jade. A 9 is really high stress, and I can imagine that's been tough. Can you tell me what's been contributing to that stress level this week?
My finals week is coming up

Finals week is definitely stressful, and it makes sense you're feeling that pressure. It sounds like even with all that stress, you still managed to stick with turning off your devices an hour before bed, which is really impressive.

Now let's think about next week. Would you like to keep working on that same sleep goal, keep it and add something new to support you through finals, or focus on something completely different?
I want to keep working on the same goal

That sounds like a solid plan, Jade. Since you said it went really well this week, what specifically went well with turning off your devices an hour before bed? And what, if anything, was challenging about it?
The alarm really heloed me compelte my goals but I fear it will get harder to do it with all the studying I hav to do later

I hear you - you're worried that when finals studying ramps up, it'll be harder to stick with turning off your devices an hour before bed, even though the alarm has been really helpful so far. That's a valid concern, especially with the pressure of exams coming up.

It sounds like you're thinking about how to balance your sleep goal with your studying needs during finals. One thing to consider is whether sticking to better sleep might actually help you study more effectively, even if it feels like you're losing study time.

What do you think would help you stick with this goal during finals week - maybe adjusting when you study, or finding ways to study without screens closer to bedtime?
